page.title: 08SHOOTING
page.content: As most of this area is heather moorland, the{shooting season}is very important. Grouse shooting (Aug 12- -Dec 10th), Partridge(Sept 1-Feb 1st), Pheasant (Oct 1-Feb 1st),and snipe (12th-Jan 31st). Black game and hares are also shot. Four{gamekeepers}are employed to keep down vermin, stoats, weasels, foxes, carrion crows and magpies. Heather is burnt regularly to encourage new growth. The shooting rights are at present owned by Arabs from Dubai, but they shoot no more than 28 days a year. There are 5-6 drives a day. each shooter stands in a butt with his loader. Two guns are used alternately. Lots are drawn for which butt is used. The birds belong to the owner of the land and the first grouse shot are sent immediately to London.
